sub_title: Currently Roaming South East Asia. Previously Consultant Solutions Architect IKEA Group focused on Cloud Development
summary: Director of Developyn currently consulting as a Solutions Architect at IKEA. I have been involved in the management, design, development and implementation of many custom web solutions for companies across a variety of sectors. With a Masters degree in Physics I have a unique way of approaching technical problems and am passionate about using new technologies to solve them.

certifications.name: UK-TEFL 20 Hour Teaching English as a Foreign Language

projects.title: BetSquad Admin Dashboard
projects.description:
BetSquad is an up and coming social betting application that's soon to be released on iOS and Android. Developyn has been working with BetSquad since November 2017 to help with both with their cloud architecture and to build their back-end APIs.

As there were no existing APIs, we were able to design the architecture from scratch and had little legacy code to consider which could get in the way. Considering BetSquad's needs, as a lean and agile start-up with a limited budget, we needed to ensure that the architecture and language we chose wouldn't be something that would have a negative impact on them in the future.

Keeping these considerations in mind, we chose to use AWS's EC2 (with Amazon Linux 2) service. EC2 is quick, easy and cheap to setup. At a cost of only £5 per server and with the ability to serve thousands of requests each day, a fleet of t2.nano instances was more than enough to cope with BetSquad's demand during their start-up. Another bonus of this infrastructure is that it's self-scaling and requires no input from Developyn after it has been set up.

To serve the API requests, we configured Nginx as a reverse proxy for Node (using ExpressJS). While Node may not be the most optimal language to use when serving potentially millions of users, it's extremely quick to write in and is easy enough to understand by any potential future developers on the project. Another particularly nice feature is Node.js is its asynchronous design, as long as the code avoids blocking the event loop, it makes it rather easy to max our the performance of our tiny t2.nano machines with no need to worry about multi-threading pools and locking up.

projects.title: Regenerative Architecture Website
projects.description:
Run by experienced architect, Nikolay Shahpazov, Regenerative Architecture is a architectural practice based in London. Taking their name very literally, they exclusively specialise in the design of ecologically sound and sustainable buildings.

The website is created using HTML, CSS, Vue.js and hosted on an S3 bucket, allowing for the website to be scale-able with no additional cost from Nikolay!

projects.title: Emedia - AnotherShot (Email Marketing Tool)
projects.description:
AnotherShot is a brand new email marketing tool built from the scratch to replace Emedia's existing email marketing program (Eshot). Eshot was created using PHP in the mid-2000's and since then has been continuously added to by Emedia to apply security patches and add new features. After 10 years of slowly applying bandages to a bled-out system, it was time to build something fresh.

Joining mid project I implemented a secure GDPR management dashboard into the existing PWA allowing Emedia to easily send erasure confirmation and access request emails to the thousands of clients in their database.

AnotherShot uses Vue.js, Bootstrap 4, Node.js (with Express), PHP (for interacting with SMTP nodes that lack a node installation), Nginx, Ubuntu.

contributors.headline: Currently Roaming South East Asia. Previously Consultant Solutions Architect IKEA Group focused on Cloud Development

projects.title: nubeGo Cloud Evaluation Software
projects.description:
NubeGo, based in Reading and headed up by cloud legend, Fernando Honig, are one of the fastest growing Cloud consultancy companies in the UK. NubeGo required a software solution to create, edit and send out cloud questionnaires to clients to be able to determine their ability to move from in-house hardware to the cloud.

The stack we chose was: Vue.js, Bulma, Node.js (& Nginx, Amazon Linux 2) and MySQL (which was later moved to Aurora Serverless). These technologies encourage rapid prototyping and development, reducing the overall cost of the project and reducing the required budget.

Authentication is delegated to Google's OAuth2 authentication service (using JSON Web Tokens), this reduces administrative burden on NubeGo and the use of JWT's allows for the easy separation of the front and back-end. The rest of the architecture follows a design that ensures no 2 components are tightly coupled, this allows for NubeGo to easily scale up and down a fleet of front and back-end servers based on their respective demands.

profile_positions.description: Enabling IKEA to see the impact of marketing activities on sales in real-time. Responsible for implementing automated data pipelines, curation and analysis platforms in Strategy & Business planning to extract and collate information from various sources (GCP Cloud, external SaaS & On-Premise) for use and analysis by other IKEA teams in a DataMesh solution. Mainly part of the Commercial Activity Management Product (CAMP) where most data is centralised to provide each marketing lead with the information they need at that point in time. Using Terraform, Node.js, Python & multiple GCP services such as BigQuery, Cloud Functions, Cloud Storage, Cloud Run & PubSub.

profile_positions.title: CTO/COO

profile_positions.description:
Lead architect of Vink, a mobile shopping list app that combines more than 14 retailers and their offers into one. Developed to be scalable with minimal maintenance at little cost. A serverless microservice approach was taken comprising 100% of AWS services. System was capable of scaling to 50,000 users with no additional costs or maintenance needed. At peak it was seeing 1000 user sign-ups a day.

All infrastructure was managed through the use of Terraform and the Serverless Framework allowing for version control and collaboration at the infrastructure level making it extremely easy to spin up and down new environments for development and QA testing.

Designed and implemented custom CI/CD pipeline to detect changes and deploy relevant services. This involved an appropriate code structure with custom libraries to ensure development was smooth & streamlined across different services.

https://vink.ai
profile_positions.title: Solutions Architect & Full Stack Developer at Vink (Corporate Venture)

profile_positions.description: Maintained the existing Tessa application across all parts of the stack. From maintaining and adding to the Node.js (ExpressJS) backend to adding new features to the custom VueJS dashboard to migrating existing systems from Heroku to AWS using Terraform in a secure way with minimum downtime and data loss to the running application whilst making extensive use of AWS services (ECS - Fargate, RDS - Aurora PostgreSQL, SES, CloudWatch, Route53, S3).
profile_positions.title: Full Stack Developer at Tessa (Corporate Venture)

profile_positions.description:
Full Stack Software Developer working on a Unilever startup project called Tessa. Maintained and added to the existing backend application as well as working on the frontend admin CMS system and the image processing and data pipelines.

Instrumental in migrating existing systems from Heroku to AWS in a secure way with minimum downtime and data loss to the running application, making extensive use of AWS services. Played a key role in reducing costs of the pre-existing AWS infrastructure by 40%

https://www.tessa.company

volunteer_experiences.description: I have been in Scouts from a very young age achieving the Chief Scout’s Gold Award and Bivouac Leader. I represented the UK as a participant in the Swedish World Scout Jamboree in 2011. I then volunteered as International Support Staff for the Japanese Jamboree in 2015. My primary role was teaching spectroscopy to young people of all ages and nationalities in French and English.

During my time with Carnival Rag I raised money for several charities including the Midlands Air Ambulance, Children with Cancer UK, Prince's Trust and Edward's Trust and most notably the Children's Society. This was primarily done through bucket shakes, cake sales and personal donations.

I also donated in other ways with my time working for free as an App Developer for the group. Along with making first versions of their iPhone Application I also wrote algorithms to help sort and match applicants for the societies award winning event "First Dates"
